main event: A round, fiery or orange-red object was observed in the sky near Nome, Alaska. The object separated into two pieces with a blue flash before disappearing.
interesting points: The object was described as bright, then it disappeared.
The object initially appeared as one, then separated into two pieces with a blue flash.
The object was traveling in a straight path from the southeast to the northwest.
Witnesses reported seeing flashes of light through their windows, which they compared to arc welding.
Additional sightings were reported in the Teller, Alaska area, with witnesses describing an elongated or round object traveling from northwest to southeast.
sighted object: Round, fiery or orange-red object that separated into two pieces
witnesses: Residents of Nome and Teller, Alaska
